snippet: Acting under a court deadline, the agency will seek a standard that will force industry, utilities and local governments to find ways to reduce emissions of particles by 2020.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency announces new standard for soot pollution that will force industry, utilities and local governments to find ways to reduce emissions of particles that are linked to thousands of cases of disease and death each year; communities must meet new standard by 2020 or face possible penalties.
lead_paragraph: Acting under a court deadline, the agency will seek a standard that will force industry, utilities and local governments to find ways to reduce emissions of particles by 2020.

headline.main: E.P.A. Sets a Lower Limit for Soot Particles in the Air
